comment: Alternate definition of the reflexive relation predicate. A relation is reflexive iff: for all elements on its domain and range, if an element of its domain is the same as an element of its range, then there is the relation between them. Note that this is definitely not the definition we are accustomed to, like e.g. ~ idref / ~ idrefALT or ~ df-reflexive ` |- ( R Reflexive A <-> ( R C_ ( A X. A ) /\ A. x e. A x R x ) ) ` . It turns out that the not-surprising definition which contains ` A. x e. dom r x r x ` needs symmetry as well, see ~ refsymrels3 . Only when this symmetry condition holds, like in case of equivalence relations, see ~ dfeqvrels3 , can we write the traditional form ` A. x e. dom r x r x ` for reflexive relations. For the special case with square Cartesian product when the two forms are equivalent see ~ idinxpssinxp4 where ` |- ( A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x = y -> x R y ) <-> A. x e. A x R x ) ` . See also similar definition of the converse reflexive relations class ~ dfcnvrefrel3 . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 8-Jul-2019.)
